message: Hi!  I have a startup and am about to lock in my first customer.  I need ASAP to get a sales "infrastructure" in place -- i.e. an invoicing system, CRM, etc.  I was wondering if anyone had a "checklist" of sorts to make sure I don't miss out on anything when setting up all the various systems?  Also, I was wondering if anyone had any specific recommendations for companies to go with?  Thanks!
We're using CapsuleCRM - free for 2 users. Fairly easy yo use
Take a look at Freshbooks for invoicing. They have some good options to get started and scale. As for CRM - what exactly do you need a CRM system for?

We use Highrise by 37signals.com and love it. Although there are more complex CRMs out there, it's easy to learn and easy to use. I believe it integrates with Freshbooks as well so you can avoid double-entry.
Thanks!  The CRM will be mainly to get off on the right foot with organizing sales leads/customers but will eventually evolve into a more comprehensive offering down the line.
Not sure how fancy of a CRM that you need, but check out Zoho CRM as well.  Free for 3 users and there are 15 days free trial for pro and enterprise edition.
